result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jerome Lee Erdman was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $900 has been applied. Remaining fine/costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment conditions as noted above for the fine.

Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges and Good Time Credit.  The Court deems the 48 consecutive hour period prior to release for huber satisfied. Sentence to commence forthwith. The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome Lee Erdman

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 11:15 a.m. Defendant Jerome Lee Erdman in court with attorney Daniel D Sondalle.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. 15TR3251 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Sondalle. No statement by DE. Court orders: 45 days WC Jail - Huber, GT, 2 days CFTS - Sentence to commence forthwith, 48 hour requirment deemed satisfied by the Court, the Court has no objection to serving the sentence in another jurisdiction, $1757 fine w/ 60 DTP or PP, $42.50 Blood Draw Cost w/ 60 DTP or PP, 24 mo DL rev/24 mo IID, OWI Assessment, DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 11, 2016 at 11:15 am.
from Atty Sondalle, Dated 9/9/2016 Re: Request to Adjourn P/S on 9/13/2016 - Request granted by the Court
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 13, 2016 at 10:15 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Daniel D Sondalle in court, appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  P/S requested and scheduled  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on June 14, 2016 at 09:50 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Daniel D Sondalle in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Sondalle requests additional status.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 09:50 am.
Status conference on May 10, 2016 at 10:10 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Daniel D Sondalle in court appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Sondalle requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 10:10 am.
Status conference at 04-04-2016 03:05 pm
Status conference at 03-04-2016 03:05 pm

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Executed bond form to be filed with the Clerk of Courts Office by no later than March 7, 2016.   No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case called @ 2:40 p.m. Attorney Daniel D Sondalle in court, appears with authorization.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. NGP entered. $900 Cash Bond ordered by the Court.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 03:05 pm.
